definition[0]: the price charged for something when you buy it immediately using cash or a cheque, rather than the full cost of something bought using CREDIT
example[0]: Ibanez guitar urgently wanted, any condition, genuine private buyer, good cash price paid or part exchange
definition[1]: in a takeover or MERGER (=when two companies combine), an amount paid to investors in cash rather than in shares
example[1]: American International’s $32.50-a-share cash price for International Lease
definition[2]: the price for immediate delivery of a COMMODITY (=oil, metal, farm product etc)
example[2]: In copper, the premium of the cash price over the three-months’ contract  (=the amount by which the cash price is more than the futures price) continued to narrow.
